notesStmt.note: Avraham: inscribed, folio 1r.A former owner's name on the inside of the front cover is not legible, but his father's name was Yitsḥaḳ of Cologne. Written in Italian cursive script.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: 13 quires of mostly 10 leaves each. Catchwords on the last page of the quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian square and cursive script, punctuated, of 15th century.

binding.p: Post-1600, brown leather with gold tooling. Gilt edges. Boxed.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum, 1841-1853 (131-153): inscribed folio ([130r]).
